routing

Class LinkStateRouting

  • java.lang.Object
    • routing.LinkStateRouting
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RoutingInterface

    public class LinkStateRouting
extends java.lang.Object
implements RoutingInterface
    Implements a Link-State routing protocol to explore the network, then uses pathfinding to find the shortest paths.
    Since:
    2014-04-07
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Joey Haas

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean autoUpdate
      Tells the class if auto updating is enabled.
      private byte deviceID
      The device ID ie., the last byte of the IP on wlan0
      private long lastReceivedPacketTimestamp
      The timestamp of the last received packet
      private long lastSentPacketTimestamp
      The timestamp of the last sent packet
      private java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock lock
      Locks some methods while busy.
      private java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Byte,java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.Byte>> networkTreeMap
      A map of sets of neighbours paired to the network IDs
      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Byte,java.lang.Byte> nextHops
      A cache of the next client a packet should go to for a given route.
      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Byte,java.lang.Byte> routeLengths
      A cache of the route lengths, from this device to another.
      private Callback sendMethod
      A callback, invoking this will run networking.Networker.send()
      private Callback updateMethod
      A callback, invoking this will run main.Communication.updateNetwork()
      private Vertex[] vertexArray
      Contains all the nodes as Vertex objects.

      • userNotification

        private void userNotification(java.lang.Byte node,
                    boolean joined)
                       throws CallbackException
        Used to send a notification of a non-neighbour node that joined or dropped (it like it's hot).
        Parameters:
        node - The node the notification is about.
        joined - True if it's a new node. False if the node dropped.
        Throws:
        CallbackException
